justification: Offer asks B to part with a low-volatility RB (Ben King) that fits B’s conservative, floor-focused profile, for two boom/bust rookie WRs—misaligned with B’s stated preferences and consensus. Mislabels King as a workhorse and Baker as a stable TE; Baker doesn’t solve A’s TE need. Rationale centers on A’s upgrade with almost no analysis of B’s incentives. Mechanically feasible, but reasoning is thin and contextually off for B.
